original: Knuts, Carl Otto Adolf, disponent, Bengtsfors, f. 9/4/99 i Hosjö, Kopparb. 1., av folkskoll. Knuts Per Olsson o. Hanna Eriksson. G. 35 m. Maj Ör-, tenblad. Barn: Lars f. 36, Per Otto 38, Anders 43. — Stud:ex. i Falun 17, avg:ex. fr. KTH (K) 23. Ing:-assist. v. J. H. Munktells Pappersfabr. A-B i Grycksbo 24-25, driftsing. f. ångcentr. v. The Chesapeake Corp., West Point, Va., USA, 26-27, skiftförman v. pappersbruket The’ Analo-mink Paper Mill i North Water Gap i Pennsylvania 27-28, pappersing. v. Johnson & Johnson i New Brunswick i New Jersey 28-29, celluhing. v. The Cornstalk Products Co. i Danville i Illinois 29-30, resa m. uppdr. att undersöka sulfat-sodamassaind. i Amerikas södra o. västra stater o. i sydl. Canada 30-31, anst. v. Fabriques Beiges d’Al-lumettes SA i Bryssel 31-32, v. Amot-fors Pappersbruks A-B i Åmotfors 32- 33, övering. v. Bengtsfors Sulfit A-B 35, disp. f. företag, sed. 46. Led. av Sv. tekn:fören. fr. 23.
translated: Knuts, Carl Otto Adolf, manager, Bengtsfors, b. 9/4/99 in Hosjö, Kopparb. 1st district, son of Per Olsson Knuts and Hanna Eriksson. Married in 1935 to Maj Örtenblad. Children: Lars, b. 1936, Per Otto, b. 1938, Anders, b. 1943. Completed secondary education in Falun in 1917, graduated from KTH (K) in 1923. Worked as an engineering assistant at J.H. Munktells Pappersfabr. AB in Grycksbo from 1924-1925, steam power plant engineer at The Chesapeake Corp. in West Point, VA, USA from 1926-1927, shift supervisor at the Analo-mink Paper Mill in North Water Gap, Pennsylvania from 1927-1928, paper engineer at Johnson & Johnson in New Brunswick, New Jersey from 1928-1929, cellulose engineer at The Cornstalk Products Co. in Danville, Illinois from 1929-1930, traveled on assignment to investigate sulfate soda pulp industries in the southern and western states of America and southern Canada from 1930-1931, employed by Fabriques Beiges d'Allumettes SA in Brussels from 1931-1932, worked at Amotfors Pappersbruks AB in Åmotfors from 1932-1933, promoted to superintendent at Bengtsfors Sulfit AB in 1935, appointed manager for the company since 1946. Member of the Swedish Technical Association since 1923.
